specific_points.point_summary: The Indian Navy reported conducting "OPERATION SINDOOR" immediately after the Pahalgam terror attack, validating its anti-missile and anti-aircraft defence capabilities and highlighting the role of its Carrier Battle Group in deterring Pakistani air elements.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: OPERATION SINDOOR Immediately after the cowardly Pakistani sponsored #PahalgamTerrorAttack, the Indian Navy validated the anti-missile and anti-aircraft defence capability in a complex threat environment using a cross platform cooperative mechanism. The operation leveraged #IndianNavy's comprehensive layered Fleet Air Defence mechanism, enabling quick and clear distinction between commercial, neutral and hostile aircraft or flying objects, and neutralisation of threats at extended ranges. The #CarrierBattleGroup with its integral Air Wing provides the first layer of this layered mechanism. The presence of our #AircraftCarrier with a large number of Mig 29K fighters and Air Borne Early Warning helicopters prevented any suspicious or hostile aircraft from closing within several hundred kilometres. Our powerful CBG, with formidable offensive capability was able to operate with impunity and maintained an uncontested presence in the area of operations, compelling the Pakistani Air Elements to remain bottled up close to the coast denying any opportunity to be a threat in maritime space. The #IndianNavy’s dominance thus ensured that should we choose to, we can strike at will. #OperationSindoor @SpokespersonMoD @HQ_IDS_India @adgpi @IAF_MCC

specific_points.point_summary: Shiv Aroor reports alleged first-hand proof of Pakistan using international passenger flights as airborne human shields, citing a pilot whose commercial aircraft was forced to rapidly descend near Jamnagar due to Pakistani drone/aircraft activity on May 9.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: ⚠️ FIRST-HAND PROOF OF 🇵🇰PAKISTAN USING INTERNATIONAL PASSENGER FLIGHTS AS AIRBORNE HUMAN SHIELDS ⚠️ Pilot friend of mine was flying a commercial aircraft from Dubai to Delhi on May 9. His flight was forced to rapidly descend from 35,000 ft to 15,000 ft by Ahmedabad ATC while entering Indian airspace near Jamnagar. The ATC’s instructions were non-routine, sudden and firm. Why? Because Pakistani drone/aircraft activity in the Sir Creek area had alerted Indian authorities. This descent wasn’t normal; it was a calculated measure to protect the aircraft amidst hostilities. Clear proof of what the Indian Government has been saying: Pakistan kept its airspace open during an air battle, recklessly endangering civil flights, even using them as potential shields. For my friend, it was surreal — he only found out the scale of the confrontation after landing. This is Pakistan gambling with human lives—in this case international passengers—plain and simple. @icao @DGCAIndia

specific_points.point_summary: Analysis by John Spencer highlights India's advanced, integrated air defense network, blending indigenous systems (Akash, QRSAM) with Israeli Barak-8 and Russian S-400, giving it an edge over Pakistan's systems.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: India’s Air Defense: More Than Just Missiles : It’s Integration That Wins Wars A noted American defense John Spencer @SpencerGuard analyst recently highlighted how India is quietly showcasing one of the most advanced, integrated air defense networks in the world. Key insights: •India’s air defense is layered and modern, blending indigenous systems like Akash & QRSAM with Israeli Barak-8 and Russian S-400. •This integration enables India to not only defend its airspace but also penetrate Chinese-built systems used by adversaries like Pakistan. •Pakistan’s reliance on HQ-9/P, LY-80, and FM-90 has proven vulnerable to India’s mix of electronic warfare, kinetic strikes, and flexible doctrine. •The core lesson: It’s not about what you buy. It’s about how you integrate it. •The Ukraine conflict echoes the same message globally survivability depends on intelligent integration, not just hardware. New India’s evolving air defense is not just a regional advantage-it’s a case study for modern warfare. open.substack.com/pub/spence… #IndiaDefense

High-value targets eliminated include: Yusuf Azhar, Abdul Malik Rauf, Mudassir Ahmad. 3. 9 confirmed terror camps, based on multi-agency intelligence. Key Targets: Bhawalpur (terrorist training camp) and Muridke (another key terrorist training site) 4. contributing_tweets.tweet_content: "Indian Navy remained forward deployed in the Northern Arabian Sea in a dissuasive & deterrent posture, with full readiness & capacity to strike select targets at sea, & on land, compelling Pakistani Naval & air units to be in a defensive posture, inside harbours"

"Within 96 hrs of the terrorist attack, the Indian Navy tested and refined tactics & procedures at sea during multiple weapon Firings in the Arabian Sea, revalidating the crew, armament, equipment & platform readiness to deliver various ordnance on selected targets precisely"

India Pakistan tensions "In the aftermath of Pahalgam terror attack, Indian Navy's Carrier Battle Group, surface forces, submarines & aviation assets were immediately deployed at sea with full combat readiness", says Navy statement

In the aftermath of the cowardly attacks on innocent Indian tourists at #Pahalgam by Pakistani sponsored terrorists on #22Apr 25, the #IndianNavy’s Carrier Battle Group, surface forces, submarines and aviation assets were immediately deployed at sea with full combat readiness, in concert with the joint operational plan of the Indian Defence Forces. Within 96 hrs of the terrorist attack, the #IndianNavy tested and refined tactics & procedures at sea during multiple weapon Firings in the Arabian Sea, revalidating the crew, armament, equipment & platform readiness to deliver various ordnance on selected targets precisely. The #IndianNavy remained forward deployed in the Northern Arabian Sea in a dissuasive and deterrent posture, with full readiness and capacity to strike select targets at sea, and on land, compelling Pakistani Naval and air units to be in a defensive posture, inside harbours or very close to their coast. As part of the escalation control mechanism, the application of force by the Navy was planned in a synchronised manner in concert with the #IndianArmy and the #IndianAirForce. Along with kinetic actions by the Army and the Air Force, the overwhelming operational edge of Indian Navy at sea, contributed towards Pakistan’s urgent request for a ceasefire yesterday. The #IndianNavy remains deployed at sea in a credible deterrent posture, to respond decisively to any inimical action by Pakistan, or Pakistan based terrorist. @SpokespersonMoD @HQ_IDS_India @adgpi @IAF_MCC

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: On the night of 8th and 9th May, starting as early as 22:30 hours, our cities had a mass raid of drones, unmanned aerial vehicles, starting right from #Srinagar and going right up to Naliya. It was a mass raid in waves and it was relentless. We were prepared and our air defence preparedness ensured that there was no damage on the ground or to any of the intended targets that the enemy might have planned for. In a measured and calibrated response, we once again targeted the military installations and surveillance radar sites at #Lahore and close to #Gujranwala -Air Marshal AK Bharti, DGAO, IAF @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy #IndiaFightsPropaganda

specific_points.point_summary: During a press briefing on #OperationSindoor, DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai detailed its aim to punish perpetrators of terror and destroy their infrastructure. He mentioned identification of nine terror camps, some in PoJK and others in Pakistan's Punjab province (e.g., Muridke, a Lashkar-e-Taiba hub), noting some were preemptively vacated. He emphasized India's self-imposed restriction to target only terrorists and prevent collateral damage. Air Marshal AK Bharti, DGAO, IAF, also showed terror camps in Pakistan's Muridke and Bhawalpur that were destroyed during the operation.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Air Marshal AK Bharti, DGAO, IAF, shows the terror camps in Pakistan's #Muridke and #Bhawalpur that were destroyed during the #OperationSindoor 🎥Watch @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy #IndiaFightsPropaganda

There were nine camps that you are now all familiar with which were confirmed by our various intelligence agencies to be inhabited. Some of these were in PoJK, while there were others that were located in the #Punjab Province in #Pakistan. Nefarious places such as Muridke, the hub centre of the Lashkar-e-Taiba has over the years bred infamous characters such as Ajmal Kasab and the likes of David Headley -DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai during the Press Briefing on #OperationSindoor @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy #IndiaFightsPropaganda

Operation Sindoor was conceptualized with a clear military aim to punish the perpetrators and planners of terror and to destroy their terror infrastructure. What I do not state here is the often-stated determination of India and its intolerance to terror. It set into motion a very diligent and microscopic scarring of the terror landscape across the borders and the identification of terror camps and training sites. The locations that emerged were numerous, but as we deliberated more, we realized that some of these terror hubs were now bereft of presence and had preemptively been vacated, fearing retribution from us. There was also a term of reference and our own binding self-imposed restriction to target only terrorists and thus prevent collateral damage -DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai during the Press Briefing on #OperationSindoor @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy #IndiaFightsPropaganda

specific_points.point_summary: Vice Admiral AN Pramod detailed the Indian Navy's immediate and sustained deployment with full combat readiness, including exercises and deterrent posture in the Arabian Sea capable of striking select targets, following the April 22 Pahalgam attack by Pakistani-sponsored terrorists. This deployment compelled Pakistani naval units into a defensive posture, and the Navy remains deployed to respond decisively.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | Vice Admiral AN Pramod says, "In the aftermath of the cowardly attacks on innocent tourists at Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir by Pakistani sponsored terrorists on 22nd April, the Indian Navy's Carrier battle group, surface forces, submarines and aviation assets were immediately deployed at sea with full combat readiness...We tested and refined tactics and procedures at sea during multiple weapon firings in the Arabian Sea within 96 hours of the terrorist attack...Our forces remained forward deployed in the Northern Arabian Sea in a decisive nd deterrent posture with full readiness and capacity to strike select targets at sea and on land, including Karachi, at a time of our choosing. The forward deployment of the Indian Navy compelled Pakistani naval and air units to be in a defensive posture, mostly inside harbours or very close to the coast, which we monitored continuously....Our response has been measured, proportionate, non-escalatory and responsible from day one...As we speak, the Indian Navy remains deployed at sea in a credible deterrent posture to respond decisively to any inimical action by Pakistan"

specific_points.point_summary: Air Marshal AK Bharti stated that the aim of #OperationSindoor was to achieve desired effects on enemy targets, not to inflict casualties, and that any casualty count is for Pakistan to determine as India's job is to hit targets, not count "body bags."

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | Air Marshal AK Bharti says, "Whatever methods and whatever means we have chosen, it had the desired effects on the enemy targets. How many casualties? How many injuries? Our aim was not to inflict casualties, but in case there have been, it is for them to count. Our job is to hit the target, not to count the body bags."

specific_points.point_summary: DGMO Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai reported approximately 35-40 Pakistani Army casualties on the Line of Control during #OperationSindoor. He added that after Pakistan launched air intrusions targeting Indian infrastructure, India used heavier weapons, likely causing further casualties which are still being assessed. Indian initial targets were terror-oriented.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | On being asked about the loss of lives to the Pakistan Army, DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai says "...I mentioned 35-40 on the Line of Control and please remember that once Operation Sindoor was launched, the responses of the Pakistan Army were also on Indian Army or the Indian Armed Forces infrastructure...Our targets were terror-oriented and later, once they launched air intrusions and air operations on our infrastructure, we've used heavier weapons and there would have been casualties, but those are still being assessed..."

specific_points.point_summary: According to @ShivAroor, all infiltration attempts by terrorists, Pakistani Army, or Special Forces during Line of Control ceasefire violations were thwarted by Indian forces.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: BREAKING: During LoC ceasefire violations, there were attempts at infiltration—whether by terrorists or Pak Army or Special Forces—but all attempts were thwarted.

specific_points.point_summary: DGMO Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai detailed that a communication with his Pakistani counterpart on May 10 led to a ceasefire agreement effective 17:00 hrs. However, Pakistan violated this within hours with cross-border firing and drone intrusions, which India met with a robust response. Another hotline message was sent to Pakistan affirming India's intent to respond fiercely to further violations, and the Chief of Army Staff has authorized Army Commanders full authority for counteraction. Further DGMO talks are scheduled for May 12.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi | DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai says "...My communication with the Pak DGMO was conducted at 15:35 hrs yesterday and resulted in cessation of cross-border firing and air intrusions by either side with effect from 17:00 hrs, 10th of May, after he proposed that we cease hostilities. We also decided to further speak on the 12th of May at 12:00 hrs to discuss the modalities that would enable the longevity of this understanding. However, disappointingly, expectedly it took only a couple of hours for Pakistan Army to violate these arrangements by cross border and across Line of Control firing followed by drone intrusions through last night and in the early hours of today. These violations were responded to robustly...We have earlier today sent another hotline message to my counterpart highlighting these violations of the understanding between the DGMOs on 10th of May and our firm and clear intent to respond to these fiercely if repeated tonight, subsequently or later...The Chief of Army Staff has granted full authority to our army commander for counteraction in case of any violation by Pakistan..."

specific_points.point_summary: Air Marshal AK Bharti detailed that #OperationSindoor involved swift, coordinated strikes on Pakistani Air Force bases (including Chaklala, Rafiq, Rahim Yar Khan, Sargodha, Bhulari, Jacobabad), command centers, military infrastructure, and air defence systems across the entire Western Front, sending a clear message that aggression will not be tolerated.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | Air Marshal AK Bharti says, "...A decision was taken to strike where it would hurt and towards that in a swift, coordinated, calibrated attack, we stuck its Air bases, command centers, military infrastructure, air defence systems across the entire Western Front. The bases we stuck includes Chaklala, Rafiq, Rahim Yar Khan sending a clear message that aggression will not be tolerated. This was followed by strikes at Sargodha, Bhulari, and Jacobabad...We have the capability to target every system at these bases and more..."

specific_points.point_summary: DGMO Lt. Gen. Rajiv Ghai stated, and other reports confirmed, that approximately 35-40 Pakistan Army personnel were killed in Indian Army artillery and small arms firing on the Line of Control between May 7th and 10th during #OperationSindoor.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #BREAKING: 35 to 40 Pakistan Army soldiers killed at LoC in Artillery gun fire by Indian Army in Jammu & Kashmir between 7th and 10th May. #OperationSindoor

#WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai says "...Some of the air fields and dumps saw repeated attacks in waves from the air. All were thwarted. The Pakistan Army has reported to have lost approximately 35 to 40 personal in artillery and small arms firing on the Line of Control between 7th and 10th May..."

specific_points.point_summary: Air Marshal A.K. Bharti and DGMO Lt. Gen. Rajiv Ghai detailed how multiple waves of Pakistani unmanned aerial systems, drones, and combat vehicles attacked IAF bases, airfields, and logistic installations starting May 8th and continuing on May 9-10. All incursions were reported as neutralized by integrated Indian Air Force and Army air defence systems with no damage on the ground. India undertook measures including deployment of air defence and electronic warfare assets.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | Air Marshal AK Bharti says, "...Commencing about 8 PM local time on 8th May, several Pakistani unmanned Aerial Systems, Drones, Combat vehicles attacked multiple IAF bases. These included Jammu, Udhamur, Pathankot, Amritsar, Bathinda, Dalhousie, Jaisalmer... these were almost simultaneous and they came in waves. All our air defence guns and other systems were waiting for them. All these waves were neutralised by our trained crew using the air defence systems that they have and also some of them were utilised using our legacy systems like Pechora, IAF SAMAR. There was no damage on ground from these incursions and these mass raids from the Pakistani side..."

#WATCH | Delhi: #OperationSindoor | DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai says "...On land, we also undertook certain measures such as deployment of air defence and electronic warfare assets to establish an integrated grid with the Indian Air Force and I have seen and heard some of you wax eloquent about the benefits of such an architecture when it comes to negating and combating air intrusions. We also carried out deployment to include movement of our forces in the land, sea and air domains. The night of the 9-10 May saw similar intrusions by drones and aircraft and this time there was a concerted effort to target airfields and some very, very important logistic installations, albeit yet again unsuccessful and denied gallantly and efficiently by the integrated Indian Air Force and Indian Army air defence..."

specific_points.point_summary: DGMO Lt. Gen. Rajiv Ghai detailed Operation Sindoor's intelligence gathering, target identification process, and operational constraints. He mentioned nine confirmed terror camps, some in PoJK and others in Pakistan's Punjab Province, including Muridke (Lashkar-e-Taiba hub). Some camps were found preemptively vacated, and the operation was restricted to targeting only terrorists to prevent collateral damage.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai says, "It set into motion a very diligent and microscopic scarring of the terror landscape across the borders and the identification of terror camps and training sites. The locations that emerged were numerous, but as we deliberated more, we realised that some of these terror hubs were now bereft of presence and had preemptively been vacated, fearing retribution from us...There was also a term of reference and our own binding self imposed restriction to target only terrorists and thus prevent collateral damage. There were nine camps that you are now all familiar with which were confirmed by our various intelligence agencies to be inhabited. Some of these were in PoJK, while there were others that were located in the Punjab Province in Pakistan. Nefarious places such as Muridke, the hub center of the Lashkar-e-Taiba has over the years bred infamous characters such as Ajmal Kasab and the likes of David Headley"

specific_points.point_summary: DGMO Lt. Gen. contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Delhi: DGMO Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai says "You are all by now familiar with the brutality and the dastardly manner in which 26 innocent lives were prematurely terminated at Pahalgam on 22nd April. When you combine those horrific scenes and the pain of the families that the nation witnessed with numerous other recent terrorist strikes on our armed forces and defenceless civilians, we knew that the time had arrived to make yet another compelling statement of our resolve as a nation. Operation Sindoor was conceptualized with a clear military aim to punish the perpetrators and planners of terror and to destroy their terror infrastructure. What I do not state here is the often stated determination of India and its intolerance to terror."

After Uri incident, the entire world saw what is the result of carrying terrorist attacks in India, when our armed forces entered Pakistan and carried out surgical strike. specific_points.point_summary: During a press conference, Indian military officials provided updates on Operation Sindoor and the subsequent ceasefire. Commodore Raghu R Nair stated that an understanding was reached to stop all military activities and all three forces were instructed to adhere, remaining fully prepared and vigilant. He also asserted that every Pakistani misadventure has been met with strength. Wg Cdr Vyomika Singh reported extensive damage to crucial Pakistani air bases (Skardu, Jacobabad, Bholari), loss of AD weapon systems and radar making Pakistani airspace defense untenable, and stated Pakistan suffered very heavy and unsustainable losses on land and air after its unprovoked attack. Col Sofiya Qureshi confirmed the destruction of Pakistan's offensive and defensive capabilities and significant damage to their military assets. She refuted Pakistani misinformation, including claims of damaging India's S400/Brahmos bases or airfields, and denied Indian military damaged mosques in Pakistan (a claim Pakistan had made), emphasizing India's secular nature and that operations targeted only terrorist camps and anti-India facilities. The Indian MoD officially indicated that India’s relentless punitive strikes on Pak bases (updated list: Nur Khan/Chaklala, Rafiqui, Murid, Sukkur, Sialkot, Pasrur, Chunian, Sargodha, Skardu, Bholari, Jacobabad) led to the ceasefire, confirming future escalations will meet a stronger response.

specific_points.point_summary: The DC Jalandhar reported a surveillance drone was downed near Mand village around 9:20 PM; public urged to stay calm, report debris without touching, avoid crackers, and note precautionary power cuts. Drone activity reportedly ceased after 10 PM.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Good evening Jalandhar 12th May 10.45 pm I have been informed that one surveillance drone was brought down by the Armed forces at around 9.20 pm near village Mand. The expert team is looking for the debris. It is requested that please do not go near the debris if you found them and immediately inform the nearest police station. It has also been informed that no drone activity has been seen in Jalandhar since 10 pm. I urge you to please be calm and also do not burst crackers as it has been reported in some areas. Strict police action will be taken against such people who will try to create panic. We have cut off light in some areas of Jalandhar as a precaution and will review the situation after some time. Nothing to worry. Regards DC Jalandhar

specific_points.point_summary: ISRO Chief V Narayanan states that 10 satellites are working to ensure safety and security, monitoring sea and northern borders.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: 10 satellites working to ensure safety and security: ISRO Chief V Narayanan Read @ANI Story | aninews.in/news/national/gen… #ISRO #ChiefVNarayanan #DGMOS

Imphal, Manipur: ISRO Chairman V Narayanan said, "At least 10 satellites are continuously working round-the-clock for the strategic purpose to ensure the safety and security of the citizens of the country." He further said, "...You all know about our neighbours. If we have to ensure the safety of our country, we have to serve through our satellites. We have to monitor our 7,000 km seashore areas. We have to monitor the entire Northern part continuously. Without satellite and drone technology, we can’t achieve that." The ISRO Chairman made the above remarks while addressing the 5th Convocation ceremony of the Central Agricultural University (CAU) in Imphal yesterday. (Source: Central Agricultural University/YouTube)

specific_points.point_summary: A message to India's younger generation advises mental preparedness for potential war losses, drawing parallels with the 1971 conflict, and warns against enemy propaganda and psyops, urging strong support for armed forces.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: This is a message for the younger generation in India who may have never seen a war. As Indian armed forces start teaching the terrorist country Pakistan a lesson, we may naturally see some losses to our forces. Losses are part of any conflict. It is the end result that matters. In 1971, Pakistan was split into two in just under two weeks. But in those two weeks, India lost 45 planes, 1 frigate, 2500+ soldiers. India also had a few thousand of our soldiers captured, and many Indian air fields and bases were destroyed. This is how wars are. Don't be in any fantasies, and prepare your mind to be as strong as our soldier on the field. Remember, it is the end result that matters. Pakistan was not just split in two, but tens of thousands of soldiers were killed, and 90,000+ were captured. The rest surrendered on their knees. So don't fall for propaganda that will come from across the borders when we see an Indian air craft downed or a soldier captured. Their propaganda power is immense to affect our psychology as a nation. Because they have their sympathizers and political agents well within in India. And, it is now the age of social media. We haven't had any big conflict in this age. So beware of the extraordinary psyops and always support our brave armed forces risking their lives for us, for whatever decisions they take.

specific_points.point_summary: The Fazilka District Administration (Punjab) issued a notice regarding safety blackouts, requesting public cooperation by turning off lights and staying indoors if a blackout is enforced. Schools are set to reopen but may be subject to change based on the situation.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Important Notice for Residents of Fazilka District. #Punjab #India Blackouts are carried out for public safety. If there is any indication of a threat, a blackout will be enforced. However, it is still advised that minimal lighting be used during the night. In the event of a blackout, all citizens are requested to cooperate by turning off all lights, just as was done on previous occasions. During this time, there is no need to panic. If a blackout occurs, everyone should remain inside their homes. The Fazilka District Administration expresses gratitude to the residents of the district for their strong cooperation in recent days. Regarding Schools: As announced by Punjab Education Minister Mr. Harjot Singh Bains, schools will reopen from tomorrow. Accordingly, the Fazilka District Administration has also decided to reopen schools in the district. However, if any indication of danger arises tonight, further information regarding schools will be shared in a timely manner through the Education Department. Issued by: Deputy Commissioner, Fazilka Date: 11 May 2025 – Issued at 5:45 PM.

He also mentioned Defence Minister Rajnath Singh inaugurating a new facility in Lucknow for annual production of 100-150 Brahmos missiles.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Hyderabad | DRDO Former Chairman, G.Satheesh Reddy says, "Many indigenous based technologies were used in this war and this war was an atmanirbhar-based warfare... The anti-drone systems which developed both by DRDO and industry were very successfully used as huge number of drones were coming in. Brahmos missile was used as a very effective, accurate and reliable weapon. The armed forces were well trained on this during the development phase and then later during the trials... Its role was very important and therefore I think today Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has inaugurated a facility in Lucknow to produce 100-150 missiles of Brahmos every year..."

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: My opinion: India must openly talk about these daily drone intrutions and firing by Pak we are hearing. No need to brush it under the carpet thinking it is small or it will stop. Anyway, people in India hear about it. No need to imagine what the world thinks doesn't matter. The world should know what India is facing. Without official emphatic narrative with warnings, even the one or two media that pick up these and post won't. If India takes action, it will be dubbed aggression very quickly by many countries to hit us and trouble us. I really can't understand this silence in building a narrative that suits us. specific_points.point_summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation regarding #OperationSindoor, linking it to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, describing it as India's new counter-terrorism policy (Decisive Retaliation, No Tolerance for Nuclear Blackmail, No Distinction Between Terror Sponsors/Terrorists), highlighting precise strikes on May 6/7, condemning Pakistan's state-sponsored terrorism (evidenced by officials at terrorist funerals), praising Made-in-India defense systems, and reiterating zero tolerance for terrorism.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Our unity against terrorism is our greatest collective strength. While this era is not meant for war, it is also not meant for terrorism. Zero tolerance against terrorism is the guarantee of a better world The way Pakistan's government and its military are fueling terrorism, it will ultimately lead to Pakistan's own downfall - Prime Minister @narendramodi #OperationSindoor #IndiaFightsPropaganda @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @PMOIndia

#OperationSindoor is India's new policy against terrorism. The operation has set a new standard-a new normal-in counter-terrorism measures. The three key pillars of India's security doctrine are: ➡️Decisive Retaliation: Any terrorist attack on India will be met with a strong and resolute response. India will retaliate on its own terms, targeting terror hubs at their roots. ➡️No Tolerance for Nuclear Blackmail: India will not be intimidated by nuclear threats. Any terrorist safe haven operating under this pretext will face precise and decisive strikes. ➡️No Distinction Between Terror Sponsors and Terrorists: India will no longer view terrorist leaders and the governments sheltering them as separate entities. - Prime Minister @narendramodi @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy #IndiaFightsPropaganda

During #OperationSindoor, the world once again witnessed #Pakistan's disturbing reality as senior Pakistani military officials openly attended funerals of eliminated terrorists, proving its deep involvement in state-sponsored terrorism. India will continue taking decisive steps to safeguard its citizens against any threat. Our country has consistently defeated Pakistan on the battlefield, and Operation Sindoor has added a new dimension to the nation's military prowess During the operation, the effectiveness of #MadeinIndia defense equipment was decisively proven. The world is now witnessing the arrival of Made in India defense systems as a formidable force in 21st-century warfare -Prime Minister @narendramodi @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy

#OperationSindoor is not just a name but a reflection of the emotions of millions of Indians. The Operation stands as an unwavering pledge of justice. On the night of May 6th and the morning of May 7th, the world witnessed this pledge turning into results Indian forces carried out precise strikes on terrorist hideouts and their training centres in #Pakistan.The terrorists had not even imagined that India could take such a big decision, but when the country is united and filled with the spirit of nation first then strong decisions are taken and results are shown -Prime Minister @narendramodi #OperationSindoor @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy

On 22 April, in #Pahalgam, the barbarism that terrorists have shown has shaken the nation and the world. Innocent people who were enjoying their holidays were brutally killed in front of their families, after being asked about their religion. This was the most horrific face of terror, an act of extreme cruelty. It was also an attempt to break the harmony of our country. We gave our armed forces full freedom to eliminate the terrorists. Today, every terrorist and every terror organization knows the consequences that await those who dare to wipe the sindoor from the foreheads of our sisters and daughters. Prime Minister @narendramodi @adgpi @SpokespersonMoD @MEAIndia @MIB_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy #IndiaFightsPropaganda #PahalgamTerroristAttack #OperationSindoor

specific_points.point_summary: User @aravind provided a detailed personal analysis and timeline summarizing the sequence of events in the India-Pakistan conflict from May 7th to May 11th, covering strikes, escalations, alleged US involvement, the DGMO-level understanding, and subsequent reactions and interpretations.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: This is my simplified understanding of what happened between May 7th, to the May 10th "ceasefire." April 22-May 7: 1) India, having already taken many punitive measures to squeeze the economy of Pak, decides to also impose military costs May 6 night - May 7: 2) Indian armed forces bomb the hell out of 9 terrorist sites based on intel, multiple times, killing 100+ terrorists and flattening their camps. 3) India's message is loud and clear. There will be severe costs including targeted killings of terrorists. "We can hit you anywhere, anytime, even after announcing we will hit giving 2 weeks to prepare, and you still can't do anything about it." 4) This is the message India wanted to deliver and the objectives were clearly met. But India was also ready for escalations by Pak. May 7 - May 8: 5) Pak escalates with drone attacks and India retaliates even harder. Taking out all their air defences and systems. 6) India again gives an off-ramp. "You can take take it and walk away. But if you hit, we will hit harder. You can't do anything." May 8 - May 9: 7) US (JD) calls India, directly speaks to PM Modi, who was kind enough to take his call, JD tells they have intel that Pak is planning for a devastating missile attack. 8) PM Modi says, and am paraphrasing, "Ok. Let them try it, we will devastate them." Hangs up. 9) India also makes it clear that if Pak wants ceasefire, the DGMO must himself call and declare it. We don't want to talk to political puppets. 10) But again that night Pak sends a barrage of drones and missiles. Including ballistic missiles, presumably targeting Delhi. All taken down by India's world's best, integrated air defence successfully. Yes, I will say it again. From what we have seen, India's integrated air defence system is now the world's best. Even better than Iron Dome but operating at a fraction of its cost. Kudos to our engineers and military. May 9 - May 10: 10) India pummels Pakistani air bases by dawn. Its hangars with planes are destroyed. Its runways are cratered. All its Chinese air defences are taken out. May 10: 10) Pak pleads to US to ask India to stop. US sec. of state, Marco Rubio, calls around 1pm IST? India makes it clear Pak DGMO needs to call and confirm he wants a ceasefire. India won't talk to anyone else. 11) Pakistan DGMO calls India around 3-4pm IST. Offers cessation of all fire in all domains. India accepts it with the condition any violation or terror attack can be seen as an act of war. May be there were other demands we do not yet know about? Like return of some terrorists under US guarantee. 12) Pak leaks the news to the US. Trump wakes up by 5 pm IST and claims he's the one who brokered the ceasefire to show himself and US as a peace maker. And also to show the US as more influential than China. 13) By 6pm, Dr. Jaishankar tweets of an "agreement reached" between India and Pakistan. He doesn't call it a ceasefire. He also doesn't talk about any US role. 14) Pakistan starts its propaganda of winning the war. International media and Trump tweet make it look like India had to agree to a ceasefire. 15) Pysops makes Indians a bit disillusioned. There's a sentiment that India must have not agreed to the "ceasefire" and hit Pakistan further. May 11: 16) Things clear up a bit. DGMO press conference is really morale boosting for Indians. They present the exact picture and how badly India had mauled Pakistan with all the proof. 17) Indians, including me, are quite happy and contented about the robust response of India and the powerful message delivered to Pak. PM Modi said we will hit all the terrorists, and those behind it and those who manage the show. India did exactly that: - 100+ terrorists dead avenging terror attacks right from 2001. - Pak military sites and bases hit, let them count the body bags. - Chinese defence systems made to look utterly useless. It is a big message to China and all the powers that are watching, no matter what is their civilian propaganda. Though we all like a little more action to put Pak in place, we also know India can get pulled into a wider war affecting our economy badly and expending our military against other threats. What we have achieved in amazing. Thanks to the resolve of our leadership and bravery of our armed forces. Jai hind. Note: This is just my understanding of the events. There may be mistakes and gaps. Feel free to correct me in the replies.

Back in 1948, when the wound of Kashmir was inflicted, American pressure was 30 times more, while now the US President seems to just take credit... We have achieved what we wanted to achieve... The Indian diplomatic establishments have been perfect... They did not exaggerate a bit..." On Congress' statement on India-Pakistan understanding, he says, "There has been an increase in how we have reacted to the activities in 2016, 2019 and 2025. There can be a question about what our question is going to be with the next terror attack that Pakistan carries out. The Pakistanis know it... Just because Trump talks to Pak PM and announces ceasefire, it means nothing. In fact, just to snub him the anti-Trump admin DS and its master China will make Pak army fire at us. They will not only provoke us after this to make Modi look weak (if he decides to ignore their provocations) and as under pressure from the US, but also to make Trump look small. Also, remember, China wants India to be in a full scale war with Pakistan. So what will India now? Is it going to take the hits and not do anything to prevent further escalation? Ok, even if it does so, how long before Pak provokes us again? Our leadership, am sure, know all this. Will do what is best. If they really decide to keep up the ceasefire for some reason that's upto them. But public will not like it.

specific_points.point_summary: User @misspathania commented on #OperationSindoor, characterizing it as a demonstration of Indian strength where the Air Force deeply penetrated Pakistani airspace and Pakistan admitted it. She contrasted this with what she termed Pakistan's 'joke' counterstrikes and criticized some opposition leaders for allegedly 'feeding enemy narratives' and 'insulting soldiers'. She praised PM Narendra Modi for changing India's retaliatory approach from 'candle marches' to direct action, hailing it as 'New India,' and commended Shiv Aroor's journalism as patriotic and trustworthy.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #OperationSindooor wasn’t just an airstrike it was a message, written across the skies of Lahore and POK in the unmistakable ink of Indian strength. For the first time in modern history, India’s Air Force pierced deep into Pakistan’s airspace, struck surgically and successfully and Pakistan admitted it! Their counterstrikes? A joke. Their air defenses? Shattered. Lahore lit up in panic. Did we want more? Of course. A full sweep. But when my Prime Minister, Narendra Modi, decides the scale of response I trust it. Because the world finally saw what India is becoming: a nation unafraid, unapologetic, and unbreakable. And yet, while our forces were defending Bharat’s izzat, some leaders from the Opposition were busy feeding enemy narratives questioning Pahalgam, calling it a false flag, and parroting propaganda that Pakistani media used word-for-word. That’s not dissent. That’s treachery. That’s an insult to every soldier standing on the border. Modi didn’t just change the way we vote-he changed the way India strikes back. No more candle marches. No more silence. This is New India. And we don’t kneel we retaliate. Jai Hind. Jai Bharat. Also if not me just listen to Shiv Aroor’s coverage as it isn’t just reporting its patriotism in motion. Unflinching, razor-sharp, and rooted in facts, he brings clarity when propaganda clouds the truth. In times of war or peace, he’s a voice every Indian can trust. Salute to real journalism. @ShivAroor #ShivAroor #IndiaFirst #OperationSindoor #ModiHaiTohMumkinHai #IndiaFirst #IndianAirForce

BCCI is pleased to announce the resumption of the TATA IPL 2025. *A total of 17 matches will be played across 6 venues, starting May 17, and culminating in the final on June 3.* The revised schedule includes two double-headers, which will be played on two Sundays. The playoffs are scheduled as follows: Qualifier 1 – May 29 Eliminator – May 30 Qualifier 2 – June 1 Final – June 3 The venue details for the playoff matches will be announced at a later stage.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: The updated schedule for the remainder of the TATA IPL 2025. A total of 17 matches will be played across 6 venues, starting May 17, and culminating in the final on June 3. (Pic: BCCI)

BCCI is pleased to announce the resumption of the TATA IPL 2025. A total of 17 matches will be played across 6 venues, starting May 17, and culminating in the final on June 3. The revised schedule includes two double-headers, which will be played on two Sundays. The playoffs are scheduled as follows: Qualifier 1 – May 29 Eliminator – May 30 Qualifier 2 – June 1 Final – June 3 The venue details for the playoff matches will be announced at a later stage.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Gujarat | ACP Ahmedabad Crime Branch, Bharat Patel says, "During our investigation into Bangladesh citizens living in India illegally, we found out about a Bangladeshi citizen from Dhaka who has identified herself as an Indian citizen with documents like an Aadhaar card and passport. specific_points.point_summary: Educational institutions in Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, are thriving with young students after schools, once shut down due to Naxal terror, have been reopened. Officials report significant progress, with over 250 schools reopened in the last five years, including 50 recently reopened schools reconnecting around 8,000 children to education. Efforts include infrastructure upgrades from huts to permanent buildings, providing books and mid-day meals, and conducting surveys to re-enroll dropout children, facilitated by increased area accessibility due to new security camps and villager cooperation.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Chhattisgarh | APC Mohd Zakir Khan says, "The Chhattisgarh government and the district administration are constantly trying to ensure that the right to education reaches every child. As part of these efforts, 50 schools have been reopened, and around 8,000 children have been reconnected to education... The district administration is providing facilities like books and Mid-day meals to the students. The villagers have also started cooperating in opening schools. Many schools were demolished during the Naxal violence, but these could be rebuilt only when the villagers helped."

#WATCH | Chhattisgarh | Bijapur Collector Sambit Mishra says, "In the last 5 years, more than 250 schools have been reopened in our district, which were earlier operating… We are upgrading the infrastructure. Earlier, schools used to be in huts, but now permanent buildings have been sanctioned for most of the schools… As schools are opening inside the villages, we are trying to get the remaining few attending school by staying in our residential facilities, like hostels, to attend schools in their villages from their homes. As security camps are opening, area accessibility is increasing, and the accessibility to education is also expanding in many ways… We are conducting surveys for dropout children in every household. After identification, we will find out why and try to get as many children as possible back to school."
#WATCH | Chhattisgarh | Educational institutions, brimming with young students, thrive in the Bijapur district, where schools were once shut down due to naxal terror.

specific_points.point_summary: An analysis suggests a potential Trump presidency, backed by the 'deep state' and military-industrial complex, could pose challenges for India, including pressure on defence purchases, trade tariffs, pharmaceutical access, and reduced access to discounted Russian/Iranian oil, despite a potentially good personal relationship between PM Modi and Trump.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: I don't want to dampen India's spirits about Trump winning. But I am sorry to say Trump's US won't be anything too good for India. Here's why: This Trump presidency will be entirely backed by the new deep state. See my reply in this thread below. The deep state operates irrespective of who's running the state. Trump acted clueless when the DS stirred up CAA protests and Delhi riots in India even as he was visiting. It will be the same, or worse, for India with respect to the US DS and its meddling in India's region. Another issue the military lobby is also backing Trump this time. So is the oil and commercial lobby, or basically a big chunk of the Military Industrial Commercial Complex of the US is backing Trump. This means India will also face direct pressure from the Trump admin on buying US weapons, face tariffs on exports, and arm twisting on letting in US pharma and other commercial interests. India will be forced to cut imports of Russian oil and even buy oil directly from the US which will flow in plenty by next year. No discounted, rupee traded, Iran oil, Russian oil or Venezuelan oil for India. Do you see the implications? India will get double whammy from both the state and the deep state. The only consolation is PM Modi has a good personal relationship with President Trump and Trump is known to be very pragmatic, business like, and independent in his decision making. Given this good equation, if India buys a number of weapons and planes from the US, lets in Starlink, Tesla, and other US commerce without trouble, and works with the US against China, all will be good in India, sans the neighborhood where USDS will continue to meddle. This is the most likely situation for India from the next year. PM Modi and his govt are very pragmatic in foreign policy. They understand the US power, and won't take the US head-on if the DS is kept in check by the Trump admin to not internally destabilize India and let India grow. But the next few months, until Trump admin takes full charge, it will be the DS utilizing the time and attacking India to the maximum.

specific_points.point_summary: US VP Vance and another official reportedly engaged with senior Indian and Pakistani leadership (including PMs Modi and Sharif, EAM Jaishankar, COAS Munir, NSAs Doval and Malik) over the past 48 hours. This engagement led to an agreement between India and Pakistan for an immediate ceasefire and the initiation of talks on a broad set of issues at a neutral location.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Over the past 48 hours, @VP Vance and I have engaged with senior Indian and Pakistani officials, including Prime Ministers Narendra Modi and Shehbaz Sharif, External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, Chief of Army Staff Asim Munir, and National Security Advisors Ajit Doval and Asim Malik. I am pleased to announce the Governments of India and Pakistan have agreed to an immediate ceasefire and to start talks on a broad set of issues at a neutral site. We commend Prime Ministers Modi and Sharif on their wisdom, prudence, and statesmanship in choosing the path of peace.

specific_points.point_summary: India has extended financial support to the Maldives by rolling over a USD 50 million Treasury Bill for one more year. contributing_tweets.tweet_content: India extends financial support to the Maldives through the rollover of the USD 50 million Treasury Bill. On the request of Government of Maldives, the State Bank of India (SBI) has subscribed, for one more year, a USD 50 million Government Treasury Bill issued by the Ministry of Finance of Maldives. Since March 2019, Government of India has been facilitating subscription of several such Treasury Bills by the SBI and rolling them over, annually, interest-free to the Government of Maldives. This has been done under a unique Government-to-Government arrangement, as emergency financial assistance to Maldives: High Commission of India in Maldives

specific_points.point_summary: South Asia analyst Michael Kugelman notes the US called for de-escalation due to rapid escalation dynamics and nuclear concerns, especially regarding Indian targeting near Rawalpindi.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | On US President Donald Trump's post on a ceasefire between India-Pakistan, Washington DC-based South Asia analyst, Michael Kugelman says, "We had seen a consistent position from the US government calling for de-escalation, so there definitely had not been any type of active mediation early on in the crisis but the US position from the started had been calling for de-escalation, even though indeed Vice President Vance and President Trump had had signaled that the US was only going to do some watch. There are 2 two reasons why we saw the US jump in the way it did to push for a ceasefire. The first reason is escalation dynamics. This was a crisis that escalated very quickly. You had significant levels of military action that were used by both sides...The second reason is the nuclear issue. My sense is that the US government was very concerned when you had the Indian targeting a particular air base in Rawalpindi, which is known to be near nuclear sites..." (11/05)

specific_points.point_summary: South Asia analyst Michael Kugelman describes the recent India-Pakistan situation as remarkable, with relations at a low point before a sudden ceasefire, which he believes will be fragile.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | On the current situation between India and Pakistan, Washington DC-based South Asia analyst, Michael Kugelman says, "It's really been quite a few weeks given how we saw such a major escalation intentions so quickly over the last few days and then further to be this very sudden ceasefire that appeared to come out of nowhere, it really is quite remarkable. I think that India-Pakistan relations were at one of the lowest points in a number of decades, and they were closer to going to war than at any time since the Kargil crisis and in that sense, the ceasefire really de-escalated things in a big way. But I think that it will be a fragile ceasefire because we know that tensions remain quite high between both countries..." (11/05)

specific_points.point_summary: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi held a phone conversation with Indian National Security Advisor Ajit Doval. According to the Chinese Foreign Ministry, Doval explained India's need for counter-terrorism actions post-Pahalgam attack but stated war was not India's choice and both countries were committed to a ceasefire. Wang Yi condemned the attack, opposed all terrorism, and expressed hope for calm, restraint, and dialogue, supporting a lasting ceasefire.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi had a phone conversation with Indian National Security Advisor Doval As per Chinese Foreign Ministry, "Doval said that the Pahalgam terrorist attack caused serious casualties among Indian personnel and that India needed to take counter-terrorism actions. War was not India's choice and was not in the interests of any party. India and Pakistan would be committed to a ceasefire and look forward to restoring regional peace and stability as soon as possible." Wang Yi said that China condemns the Pahalgam terrorist attack and opposes all forms of terrorism. The current international situation is turbulent and intertwined. Peace and stability in the Asian region is hard-won and deserves to be cherished. India and Pakistan are neighbours that cannot be moved away, and both are neighbours of China. China appreciates your statement that war is not India's choice, and sincerely hopes that India and Pakistan will remain calm and restrained, properly handle differences through dialogue and consultation, and avoid escalation of the situation. China supports and expects India and Pakistan to achieve a comprehensive and lasting ceasefire through consultations. This is in the fundamental interests of India and Pakistan and is also the common wish of the international community: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

Breaking: Indian NSA Ajit Doval, Chinese FM Wang Yi hold talks Full China Statement: On May 10, 2025, Wang Yi, member of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and Director of the Office of the Central Commission for Foreign Affairs, held a phone conversation with Indian National Security Advisor Ajit Doval. Doval stated that the Pahalgam terrorist attack had caused significant casualties among Indian personnel, and that India needed to take counter-terrorism actions. He emphasized that war is not India's choice and does not serve the interests of any party. Both India and Pakistan are committed to maintaining the ceasefire and hope for the early restoration of regional peace and stability. Wang Yi expressed China's condemnation of the Pahalgam terrorist attack and its opposition to all forms of terrorism. He noted that, given the current complex and volatile international situation, peace and stability in Asia are hard-won and should be cherished. India and Pakistan are neighboring countries that cannot be relocated, and both are also neighbors of China. China appreciates Doval’s statement that war is not India's choice and sincerely hopes that both sides will remain calm and exercise restraint, resolve differences through dialogue and consultation, and avoid further escalation. China supports and looks forward to India and Pakistan achieving a comprehensive and lasting ceasefire through negotiations, which is in the fundamental interests of both countries and the shared aspirations of the international community.

specific_points.point_summary: Fact-checker @zoo_bear (AltNews) debunked a viral video that falsely claimed to show Pakistani JF-17 and J-10C aircraft being intercepted by Indian S-400 missiles over Amritsar. The footage was identified as originating from 2024, depicting Hezbollah rockets aimed at Israeli settlements.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: The viral video claiming to show Pakistani JF-17 and J-10C fighter aircraft intercepted by Indian S-400 missiles over Amritsar is actually 2024 footage of Hezbollah rockets targeted at Israeli settlements | @Shinjineemjmdr altnews.in/viral-video-of-pa…

specific_points.point_summary: Fact-checker @zoo_bear (AltNews) debunked another piece of misinformation: a 2016 image showing the evacuation of a Turkish pilot from a crash site was falsely circulated (including by Zee News) as depicting a Pakistani pilot captured by India.

specific_points.point_summary: Fact-checker @zoo_bear (AltNews) reported that multiple major Indian news outlets (including Aaj Tak, News 18, Times Now, ABP, NDTV) erroneously broadcast an old video clip (at least four years old) claiming it showed Indian air defence systems intercepting a Pakistani aerial attack over Jaisalmer during the recent conflict. A related fact-check video link was also shared.

specific_points.point_summary: @AdityaRajKaul accuses Pakistan Army’s DG ISPR of being a propagandist and disinformation peddler. He contrasts DG ISPR's claim that Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Hafiz Abdul Rauf is not dead (a claim India never made about this individual) with India's assertion that Hafiz Abdul Rauf attended a funeral with the Pakistan Army. Kaul further states India killed Jaish-e-Muhammad Chief Abdul Rauf Asghar, suggesting Pakistan is exploiting similar names to mislead.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Pakistan Army’s DG ISPR is a master propagandist and Disinformation Peddler. Today he claimed Lashkar e Tayyiba commander Hafiz Abdul Rauf isn’t dead. But India never claimed he is dead. India said he attended funeral of Lashkar terrorists with Pakistan Army in Muridke. (First two pics below) India has killed Jaish e Muhhamad Chief and brother of Masood Azhar, Abdul Rauf Asghar in Bahawalpur. (Last pic below) Just because both Lashkar and Jaish terrorists have similar name, Pakistan is fooling Pakistani Journalists and International Community. What a joke!

He indicates an assessment of some pictures will follow.

Some pics yes, bt wil come with assessment soon. -How come Indian drones reached Peshawar (unless radars are damaged) -No proof of Indian missiles reaching 🇦🇫 -No proof of Indian missiles frm Sirsa reaching Amritsar

specific_points.point_summary: A user calls for an 'infowar' campaign to discredit perceived anti-India publications by creating and circulating fake, mock headlines attributed to them to damage their reputation.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: I have a request. Please create many screenshots like this. With different "believable" claims from National Interest. Like "Pakistan has hit Khan Market in Delhi with its Turkish drones." "Pakistan has sunk India's Aircraft carriers." "Pakistan has bombed Taj Mahal where India kept its Nukes." The headlines must match National Interest and look authentic. Flood SM and internet with it mocking the publication in comments. Destroy the reputation of this Chinese-Paki-DS mouth piece in the world as naive people seeing it realize 9/10 they claimed never happened. This is how we fight infowar. Wish we could run MIB with the resources to do it to every media house in vernacular destroying their crediblity over time. Still suggest MIB to consider such capablities and unleash it. There's still time. For now, if our SM warriors can do it, will be great. Don't leave any anti-India publicaiton.

specific_points.point_summary: A resident of Jammu and Kashmir reports that borders are calm, refuting claims of ceasefire violations and accusing some media outlets ('Noida Media') of sensationalism, fake news, and war-mongering.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Dear Noida Media! There has been no ceasefire violation in Uri, Karnah, Gurez, Machil, Akhnoor, Surankote, Poonch, or Rajouri. Borders are calm. We, the locals (Jammu and Kashmir), live here. We are the ones at the borders. We know the truth. But Noida- based war-mongers have created a culture of fake news, sensationalism, panic-mongering, and Low-grade journalism. Your war-thirsty studios are hell-bent on manufacturing chaos here. You’ve turned journalism into a circus of lies, fear, and filth. Spare us. We don’t want war. We just want peace and dignity. #IndiaPakistanWar #ceasefire @zoo_bear @svaradarajan @_sayema @rohini_sgh @AbhishekSay @imMAK02 @suhasinih @khanumarfa @svaradarajan @samar11 @manaman_chhina

specific_points.point_summary: A claim by Pakistan's DGISPR of sending drones to Delhi was met with sarcastic disbelief, framing the alleged action as implausible and mocking its potential nature.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Pakistan’s DG ISPR claims they’ve sent drones to Delhi. 😂😂 Well… this might actually be true — maybe they packed a few second-hand drones in plastic bags and sent to Mayapuri scrap market in New Delhi. After all, one can get decent money for junk like that.😉

specific_points.point_summary: Critique by @AdityaRajKaul of Nic Robertson's media reporting, alleging it aligns with Pakistan Army (ISPR) narrative. Asserts that this reporting omits the reality of Pakistan being stunned by Indian attacks, which forced them into a ceasefire dialogue, and reiterates India's stance against Pakistani terrorism with #OperationSindoor as a red line.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Why is Nic Robertson reading from ISPR script as if he has been briefed by Pakistan Army on what to say on TV? This is so far away from reality. Pakistan was stunned and went into huddle after Rawalpindi and several Pakistani Airbases and Mil Stations came under attack by India for aggression. Pakistan knew that it can’t stand India’s retaliation in the long run. Pakistan was forced into a ceasefire because they knew what was coming. No word on Pakistan sponsored terrorism. No word on Jihadist nature of Asim Munir. No word on chaos in Pakistani Govt and political turmoil. Don’t hide reality from Global audience. Pakistani military was brought to its knees before it could come to talk begging for back-channel dialogue. India won’t tolerate Pakistani terrorism and proxy war. #OperationSindoor is a message and a Red Line.

specific_points.point_summary: PIB Fact Check refuted social media claims of heavy explosions in Udhampur as false, stating no such incidents occurred and that these rumors aim to create panic, urging reliance on official sources.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Claims of heavy #explosions in #Udhampur are circulating on social media #PIBFactCheck: ▶️ The claim is #FALSE ▶️There have been no explosions in #Udhampur ▶️ These rumours are being spread to create #panic ▶️ Rely only on official government sources for accurate information #IndiaFightsPropaganda

specific_points.point_summary: PIB Fact Check debunked social media claims of drone sightings in Jammu & Kashmir as fake, confirming no drone activity and advising vigilance and reliance on official sources.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: Social media posts claims that #drones have been spotted in certain areas of #Jammu & #Kashmir #PIBFactCheck ✅ This claim is #fake. ✅ There is no drone activity in Jammu & Kashmir 🔎Stay vigilant. Rely only on official sources for authentic information #IndiaFightsPropaganda

specific_points.point_summary: Dr. Sarvapriya discusses the policy of banning unverified 'source-based' news at NDTV India & NDTV Profit unless proven with documents, while acknowledging its validity for whistle-blowers.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: In NDTV India &NDTV Profit, I had banned all 'source' based news, unless I was shown documents to prove its validity. Source based news is a valid form of journalism, because the 'source' is sometimes a whistle-blower, who is restricted by the law from revealing the information.

They highlighted Pakistan's history of harming Sikh interests and spreading misinformation.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: #WATCH | Members of the Indian Sikh Community reject Pakistan's propaganda that Indian forces themselves attacked Gurudwaras in India. Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee President Harmeet Singh Kalka says, "...Pakistan is claiming to be a well-wisher of Sikhs...The people of the nation know that Pakistan is the enemy of the nation and of Punjab. The youth of Punjab have been ruined due to drugs...We cannot expect Pakistan to give statements on love and brotherhood. If they claim to be well-wishers of Sikhs, then they should tell that at the time of partition, there were 20 lakh Sikhs; today, there are only 8000 Sikhs in Pakistan. Most of them have been pressured to convert...They cannot mislead the Sikhs of the nation."

#WATCH | Members of the Indian Sikh Community reject Pakistan's propaganda that Indian forces themselves attacked Gurudwaras in India Poonch, J&K | General Secretary of Saheb Mahant Sahib Ji Gurudwara, Balbir Singh says, "The army of Pakistan could not stoop any lower... I was present in the Gurudwara when a Pakistani bomb touched the boundary wall of our Gurudwara... They are carrying out a propaganda... Not one, they (Pakistan) have hit three of our Gurudwaras... The Pakistan Army is infamous in the entire world. They are carrying false propaganda and are saying that the Indian Army is carrying out these attacks..."

specific_points.point_summary: Vice Admiral AN Pramod (DGNO) detailed the Navy's role in #OperationSindoor, stating the aircraft carrier group ensured no hostile aircraft approached within hundreds of kilometers, validated anti-air/missile defenses post-Pahalgam attack, and confined Pakistani air assets near the Macron coast.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: “Our aircraft carrier, supported by MiG-29Ks and early warning helicopters, ensured no hostile aircraft approached within several hundred kilometers,” said Vice Admiral AN Pramod, DGNO, on #OperationSindoor. “Following the Pakistan-sponsored terrorist attack in #Pahalgam, we swiftly validated our anti-air and anti-missile defences in a complex threat scenario using integrated systems.” “Our carrier battle group operated with full freedom, forcing Pakistani air assets to stay confined near the Macron coast, with no access to the maritime space.” @rajnathsingh @DefenceMinIndia @SethSanjayMP @HQ_IDS_India @adgpi @indiannavy @IAF_MCC @MIB_India @PIB_India @PIBFactCheck

specific_points.point_summary: Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai (DGMO) stated during the #OperationSindoor briefing that India's precision strikes targeted terrorists without crossing the LoC/IB, anticipated a similar Pakistani response, and had proactively readied integrated air defence systems (Counter-UAS, EW, AD weaponry) with the IAF.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: “Our precision strikes on terrorist targets were conducted without crossing the #LineofControl or the international boundary. Based on this, we anticipated that Pakistan would respond in a similar manner. Accordingly, we had proactively readied our air defence systems,” said Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai, Director General Military Operations (DGMO), during the press briefing on #OperationSindoor. “Our Counter-Unmanned Aerial Systems, electronic warfare assets, and air defence weaponry were seamlessly integrated with the Indian Air Force’s corresponding systems, ensuring a coordinated and robust defence posture,” he added. @rajnathsingh @DefenceMinIndia @SethSanjayMP @HQ_IDS_India @adgpi @indiannavy @IAF_MCC @PIB_India @PIBFactCheck

specific_points.point_summary: Air Marshal AK Bharti (DGAO, IAF) clarified during the #OperationSindoor briefing that India's objective was solely anti-terrorism targeting identified threats on May 7, accused the Pakistan Military of escalating the situation by aligning with terrorists, and highlighted the effective performance of IAF Air Defence Systems.

contributing_tweets.tweet_content: “Our objective was solely to combat terrorism and eliminate #terrorist threats. Accordingly, on May 7, our operations focused exclusively on identified terrorist targets,” stated Air Marshal AK Bharti, Director General Air Operations (DGAO), Indian Air Force, during a press briefing on #OperationSindoor. “Regrettably, the Pakistan Military chose to align itself with the terrorists, escalating the situation into a direct confrontation,” he added. Air Marshal Bharti also emphasized the effective deployment and strong performance of the Indian Air Force’s Air Defence Systems during Operation Sindoor. #JusticeServed @rajnathsingh @DefenceMinIndia @SethSanjayMP @HQ_IDS_India @adgpi @indiannavy @IAF_MCC @PIB_India @PIBFactCheck

BREAKING ⚠️ Foreign Secy Vikram Misri confirms ceasefire violations by Pakistan post today’s ceasefire. Also confirms drone activity. Calls it a ‘repeated breach of the understanding’. Calls upon Pakistan to take ‘appropriate steps’. Armed forces instructed to deal strongly.

Complete comments by foreign secretary Vikram Misri this evening: For the last few hours, there have been repeated violations of the understanding arrived at earlier this evening between the Directors General of Military Operations of India and Pakistan. This is a breach of the understanding arrived at earlier today. The armed forces are giving an adequate and appropriate response to these violations and we take very very serious note of these violations. We call upon pakistan to take appropriate steps to address these violations and deal with the situation with seriousness and responsibility. The armed forces are maintaining a strong vigil on the situation. They have been given instructions to deal strongly with any instances of repetition of the violations of the border along the International Border as well as the Line of Control. Thank You.
